notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

body.p: The tailors and pressers who are employed at second-hand tailoring and who are more exploited than others in their trade, have finally organized themselves into a Union.

The first organizational meeting was held yesterday in Arkin's Hall, 831 Maxwell street. About 100 workers were present. A committee was appointed to negotiate with the Amalgamated about uniting with the great tailoring body.
The following officers of the new Union were elected: Adelman, vice-president; Cohen, treasurer; Harry Cohen, recording secretary; Kramer, financial secretary.
